original: Björck, Erik Sigfrid, stadsläkare, Mölndal, f. 1/11/91 i Falkenberg av prov:läk. Carl Henrik B. o. Eliza Kjellberg. G. 18 m. Laila Lindegren. Barn: Ulla f. 20, Birgit (adopt.) 23. — Stud:ex. i Stliim 10, med. kand. i Upps. 14, med. lic. där 18. Stud:resa t. Köpenhamn 19. Tf. und :läk. v. Sö-dermanl. 1. tub :sjukh. 17, v. Varbergs las. 20, vik. e. prov:läk. i Fässbergs distr. 21-23, assist, v. barnsjukh. Kai-serin Augusta Victoria Haus, Berlin-Charlottenburg, 18, läk. v. Mölndals folksk. 19-28, v. dess epidrsjukh. 22-46 samt v. dess komm. sinnessjukanst. 23-45, stadsläk. i Mölndal sed. 23.
translated: Björck, Erik Sigfrid, town doctor, Mölndal, born on November 1st, 1891 in Falkenberg, son of provincial physician Carl Henrik B. and Eliza Kjellberg. Married on the 18th with Laila Lindegren. Children: Ulla born in 1920, Birgit (adopted) born in 1923. He completed his high school education in Stockholm in 1910, graduated with a Bachelor of Medicine degree from Uppsala in 1914, and a medical license in 1918. He went on a study trip to Copenhagen in 1919. He served as a temporary assistant doctor at Södermanland's tuberculosis hospital in 1917, at Varberg's county hospital in 1920, and as a substitute provincial physician in Fässberg's district from 1921-1923. He was an assistant at the Kaiserin Augusta Victoria Haus children's hospital in Berlin-Charlottenburg in 1918, was a doctor at Mölndal's elementary school from 1919-1928, worked at their epidemic hospital from 1922-1946, and at their community mental hospital from 1923-1945. He has been the town doctor in Mölndal since 1923.
